text: John Barrymore (John Sidney Blyth, February 15, 1882 - May 29, 1942) was an American movie, television, stage, and radio actor. He was known for his roles in Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde (1920), Grand Hotel (1932), Dinner at Eight (1933), Twentieth Century (1934), and Don Juan (1926). His brother is Academy Award- winning actor Lionel Barrymore. His granddaughter is actress Drew Barrymore. Barrymore was born on February 15, 1882 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.North American Theatre Online: John Barrymore He was married to Katherine Corri Harris from 1910 until they divorced in 1917. Then he was married to Blanche Oelrichs from 1920 until they divorced in 1925. Then he was married to Dolores Costello from 1928 until they divorced in 1934. Then he was last married to Elaine Barrie from 1936 until they divorced in 1940. Barrymore had three children. Barrymore died on May 29, 1942 in Los Angeles, California from cirrhosis, aged 60. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * Category:1882 births Category:1942 deaths Category:Actors from Philadelphia Category:American movie actors Category:American radio actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Barrymore family Category:Deaths from cirrhosis Category:Disease- related deaths in Los Angeles
